result.execSummary:
The defendant John Henry C Smith was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of Methamphetamine [Modifiers: Repeater], a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(g).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
STAYED
Concurrent with: Concurrent with the sentence in La Crosse Co case 13CF827
.

STAYED;  Conditions of Extended Supervision are the same as the conditions of Probation that is imposed
.

Concurrent with: Concurrent with probation in La Crosse Co case 13CF827 with conditions also concurrent
.

miscConds.notes:
Obtain and maintain employment or undergo a course of education or a combination of both
.

Def to undergo Alcohol and Drug Assessment and follow through with any treatment recommendations.
.

Def is not to consume or possess any alcohol or controlled substances without a prescription from licensed physician, with random testing

No Contact with users or dealers of illicit drugs or controlled substances

The def is not to be at any place where illicit drugs or controlled substances are found, kept, used or sold
.

Comply with any other conditions that the PO deems necessary

Pay Crime Lab and Drug Assessment fee (see 'other' above for amount)

Pay DOC Supervision fees

If probation/extended supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of resititution victims and/or govermental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. John Henry C Smith

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
From: DOC Re: sentence credit?
RAG: leave as is also considered me on 13CF827 concurrent.
Per Cindy H.:  Hrg on 10-15-15 was for Civil Case only - criminal cases were not called

State by Skemp /  Def in custody w/ Atty Sean O'Neill
CRT:  Mr. Smith had filed a request for Writ of Habeas Corpus - we had a Status last week - we are waiting on whether an ATR was going to be made available & I was advised this morning that had come thru - is the DOC position?
Jerri H., DOC Supervisor (by phone):  we do know he is accepted into the program, they have not yet given us a bed date - once I get bed date there will be consideration for the release
CRT:  if he said he wouldn't go there, then what?
Jerri H.:  so question really is, where are we at w/ Farnam - we know he's accepted - we don't habe a bed date - I don't know what their process is when they will let us know that bed date
CRT:  Mr Smith says he has apartment...it's furnished & ready for him & he can occupy that apartment until placement @ Farnam
Jerri H.:  yes, that was one of things we needed to know
Def:  has a job also
O'Neill:  procedurally I would like Writ to be filed - I will take off the Hrg date - DOC doesn't have formal notice about this.  Def does want to move forward w/ Habeas Corpus - he's been on hold so long.  He's been sitting 4 mos & now DOC is asking him to sit longer - Farnam is a shorter program
CRT:  I would ask State be prepared to argue that Motion this week.
Skemp:  I will ask that an Atty be assigned immediately to handle that Hrg
MOTION HRG:  10-15-15 @ 3 pm w/ RAG
CRT:  DOC could decide on their own to release def to the community - if so, the CRT would not have any objection & if that happens, there will be no need to have the Hrg on the 15th

STC off the record
O'Neill to update the Court on friday

State by Keller / Def w/ Atty Sean O'Neill
Neg Plea /  Plea Quest & Waiver filed
Ct 3 - Def pleads GUILTY
CRT goes over Plea Quest w/ def, accepts plea & finds def guilty
Remaining Cts are Dismissed & read-in
CRT'S SENTENCE:  Def sentenced to WSP for total length of sentence of 3 yrs:
- Initial Term of Confinement is 1 Yr w/ credit for 80 days - Concurrent w/ La Crosse Co 13CF827 - def is eligible for CIP & ERP
- Extended Supervision is 2 yrs w/ conditions:  AODA & follow-thru;  No alcohol, drugs or cont subs w/o valid prescription w/ random testing;  No Contact w/ users or dealers of illicit drugs or cont subs;  Def is not to be at any place where illicit drugs or cont subs are kept, used or sold;  Comply w/ any other conditions PO deems appropriate;  Pay CC & DOC fees
**PER CRT:  REFUND CASH BOND TO PERSON THAT POSTED IT**
Motion for Consolidation w/ cases 13CF827 & 14CF393 - Order consolidating cases in Br 1 signed by RAG
From: Atty O'Neill Re: set for Plea
Plea hearing on September 29, 2014 at 11:15 am.

11:30 am    Def in court w/ Atty Sean W O'Neill.  Def in custody. Timothy Gruenke appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Plea offer made.  Prelim waiver filed - signed/understands.  No promises/threats.
COURT finds he F, V & I waived his right to a PH.  Probable cause found - Bound over for trial.
Information filed - Reading waived.  Def Stands Mute - NG Pleas entered.

PTC:  7/11 at 2:30 pm    STC:   8/7 at 10 am   TWB          Bond to continue.

P, in custody, w/Atty - complaint to atty
Prelim Hrg:  6-18-14 @ 11 (TWB)
$2500 cash bond reqd - no contact w/drug users or dealers, curfew 10pm-6am, no cont sub w/o valid prescription, comply w/CHJS including testing and electronic monitoring.
